Text.Value: I felt Shadowheart's presence in your mind, and with it, the artefact. She succeeded in retrieving it, but then it is you who appeared, not her. Where is the artefact?
I imagine she will have something to say about the matter. If we must return, let it be with blades bared.

EditorData.NodeContext: Snort of contempt for Viconia, and for us if we plan on giving Shadowheart to her.

Text.Value: Perhaps... perhaps I am being ungrateful. You spared me having to look upon that whelp Shadowheart's face again.
Welcome to the true heart of the House of Grief. For what is grief but a facet of loss? And what is loss but the very nature of my Lady Shar's power?
Long gone. That thing was more trouble than it was worth.
No, I think not. The artefact occupies you greatly, I felt it. Most curiously as well - like you hate it and need it. Millstone and life preserver.
We already spoke - if you can call that 'Mapping' farce a conversation.
What can a worm teach others but how to crawl? Shadowheart has no need of your 'instruction', Viconia.

EditorData.NodeContext: Contempt for Viconia and whatever lessons she proposes to teach.

Text.Value: *Viconia trails off, holding your gaze with a dark, hungry look. She has staked everything on acquiring the Astral Prism.*
We shall see.
Speak, then.
When I deal with the Absolute, my standing with Lady Shar will be stronger than ever. My rightful place is at her right hand, and I will remain there.
Shadowheart. Surrender her to me - she has much to answer for.
How about the artefact for your life? And perhaps even my support in the battles yet to come, against the Absolute?
Somehow I'm not sure I should tell you.
We learned all we could - the artefact was the one thing the Absolutists feared. The one thing they desperately wanted to keep out of their enemies' grasp. I had to have it.
Then this will be a very short conversation. I have not assembled my forces here just to spectate.
A bold claim given your current circumstances. I have not assembled my forces here just to spectate.
Let me go, and I'll bring her to you.
The artefact. Tell me everything.
These Sharrans erase the personality of all those who threaten them. Just another miserable cult.
Perhaps she is above such mortal concerns, but I must preserve her church, even if she does not ask me to.
Unless, of course, you are intent on attacking me again? I would not advise it.

EditorData.NodeContext: Cautioning - referring to how the player attacked an illusion of her earlier.

Text.Value: Say nothing.
You and I need to speak...
The Astral Prism is with me. And it's staying with me.
The child Shadowheart can be irritating and naive, but what do you hope to gain by handing her to DeVir?
Remember our agreement - deliver Shadowheart to me, and you can count upon Lady Shar's warriors at your side, when the time comes.
Attack.
You've finally found yourself a following, Mother Superior. And you only had to hollow out their heads to do it.
Whispers reached my ears from all corners - potential rivals of Lady Shar, all vying for the same prize. A new god, amassing the disaffected, the outcasts - those who should turn to us.

EditorData.NodeContext: Note of anger at the end - the Absolute is encrouching on her goddess's territory

Text.Value: Go, fetch her. And should you not stay true to your word... well...
Ah, as I thought. Quite an adventure has brought you to this point - illithids, kidnapping, infection, the Hells, hunted by cultists and githyanki alike... and of course, the artefact.
So let the others fight, while we wait. Once they are spent and bloodied from each other, we would slip in and take the prize. Alas, most of those I sent, perished. All but one - Shadowheart.
To fight so many foes openly could prove unwise. Shar's children are better deployed as daggers in the shadows, not massed upon a battlefield.
What will you do to her?
Turn to leave.

I saw in your mind, when we spoke above. Quite an adventure has brought you to this point - illithids, kidnapping, infection, the Hells, hunted by cultists and githyanki alike... and of course, the artefact.
This better be a long con, soldier.

EditorData.NodeContext: Aside, to the player, after the player has said to an enemy that they will betray Shadowheart.

Text.Value: Lady Shar's concerns lie elsewhere - with another. But she is a goddess... she can afford to ignore that which does not threaten her.

EditorData.NodeContext: Hint of tension between her and her goddess. Their goals aren't aligned

Text.Value: I shall find her in due time. Perhaps I'll disguise myself, and ask your corpse where she's hiding.
You have value. Quite an adventure has brought you to this point - illithids, kidnapping, infection, the Hells, hunted by cultists and githyanki alike... and of course, the artefact.
I think we both know exactly what she means by that. Our girl would be gone.

EditorData.NodeContext: To the player, after a bad guy has said SH will be 'reeducated' if brought to the Sharran cloister. Foreboding, not willing to give up SH.

Text.Value: I suppose dealing with you will have to suffice.
Tsk'va. You would trade out a proven ally for the empty promises of Shar's despotic disciple?
Reeducation. Viconia would feed Shadowheart a doctrine of lies before she could see the plain truth.
This 'Absolute' is but an upstart; disturbing the natural order and threatening to impede the glorious return of Lady Shar's pure, endless darkness.
Humour me with a little negotiation. Perhaps we can find terms that will allow blades to remain sheathed.
*You suddenly realise what has been troubling her. Shar has rewarded her loyalty by forcing her to groom her own replacement - Shadowheart.*

RollAdvantageReason.Value: You learned of how Viconia resented Shadowheart

Text.Value: I can't give you the artefact. But I can give you Shadowheart.
Shar bid you to do all of this?
I had to act. I had to strangle that foul conspiracy while it was still in the cradle.
Not happening. Even if I wanted to give it to you, I can't. The artefact is bound to me. It will kill you.
I don't know what you're talking about.
A trap? Perhaps. But not all traps need to be sprung. Sometimes it's wiser to await an even greater prey.
With such an audience? A trap, if I ever saw one.
Please, do you truly think that is an option?
You are truly out of your mind, to even consider the notion. Shadowheart is our ally - our friend.
It's called an Astral Prism. And let me guess - you want it. An old song, take my word for it.
A necessary ruse - one that allowed me to seek out your true intentions. The House of Grief attracts all manner of people, but only some have value to Lady Shar.
I will not be replaced by Shadow...
My interest is defeating the Absolute. It seems you're on that path already. I will not have it said that I am unreasonable.
Killing me will achieve nothing. There's a greater threat to face together - the Absolute.
You thought you could best the Absolute? The githyanki?
'Reeducation?' Forced indoctrination, more like - her memories cleansed, her mind a clean parchment for Viconia to write on.
Why do you even want it?
I know I have value to my patron - but what you see in me I've no idea.

Its name does not concern me. Its power does. I have been awaiting word of this item for some time, ever since I dispatched a cadre of Lady Shar's children to retrieve it. I have been very patient, but no more.
The Absolute shall be dealt with in time. You shall be dealt with right now.
Oh, but I shall. I'll just ask your corpse where she's hiding.
Shadowheart is one of us. Betray her, and you betray us all.
Do not insult our intelligence. You'd erase her, make a blank vellum of her mind, her memories, and inscribe it with your poison.
No. You can't have her.
'Reeducation' sounds an awful lot like enslavement to me.

EditorData.NodeContext: Astarion's not impressed, given his own history

Text.Value: We already spoke - while you tried to poke about in my thoughts.
I've heard enough.
She was mine to deal with - you robbed me of that.
Always a pleasure to see old acquaintances. But you would be wise to not interfere in this matter.

EditorData.NodeContext: A little bittersweet, before hardening into a warning. Addressed to Minsc and/or Jaheira (old companions of hers from earlier games, shocked to see her again).

Text.Value: My Lady ... she does not heed this new threat. This Absolute.
Sure, fine - whatever we have to say to escape this woman.
Impossible - she's dead.
She will be reeducated. Lady Shar may still have use for her - under my control.
*You feel the barest of presences caress your mind - she's reading your thoughts.*
Too late to keep your counsel, I'm afraid. You already revealed so much to me during the Mapping.
Shadowheart has no need for any of Viconia's educating. She is sinister enough by herself - and our ally all the same.
L'il Alurl! For Shar!

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Viconia gestures for her followers to attack

Text.Value: As far as the artefact is concerned, there's nothing to discuss.

I did not consent to questions. But I suppose you have undergone a great deal to reach this place, and anything I tell you cannot compromise me now - for you will either leave on my terms, or not at all...
Reconsider. Aid me, and you can count on my support against the Absolute. Reject me, and your journey ends here.
Very well. You may go freely, and count upon Lady Shar's warriors when the final battle is met.
We will? My friend, has it escaped your notice that Viconia is not good...?
Reeducation. As if this sect has not mangled poor Shadowheart's mind enough already.

EditorData.NodeContext: grim. imagining what torments will await a companion if betrayed

Text.Value: Pin your eyes to the treacherous she-drow. Do not focus on the many, many others - Boo will handle them.
Linger if you wish, but there is little else to be said until the Absolute's armies launch their final assault. We shall be ready.
A ruse, surely? You cannot actually intend to betray Shadowheart, after all you have been through... can you?
Shar will allow you to make such an offer?
All right, you wish to negotiate? Make me an offer then.
This must be truly important, if Shar would allow you to make such an offer. Why do you want it?
The artefact alone can't save you. Best if we unite against our common enemy - the Absolute.
You may have evaded the Mapping of the Heart, but never mind - I can delve into your true intentions right now...
Then answer me - where is the artefact?
Oh but I think you do - the Mapping unearthed much more than your heartform - I saw all your secrets.
I must keep her faith alive in mortal hearts. I must defend her ways, lead her children, stop all threats. Even if I must go against her wishes, I will prove myself her most loyal servant.

Synopsis: Short dialog if player tries to approach Viconia without Shadowheart nearby. Viconia seeks to acquire the Astral Prism (the artefact SH once guarded) but that is impossible. Instead, Viconia demands the player demand SH to her for punishment, or else she and her followers will attack.
